meanings.definition: (adjective) used for emphasis or to express annoyance
meanings.sent1: She was blinking mad when her brother ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The blinking noise from the construction site was driving me crazy.
meanings.sent3: I can't believe you forgot my birthday again, it's just blinking frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The blinking sun was so bright, I had to squint my eyes.
meanings.sent5: The blinking red light on the alarm clock was a constant reminder of how late I was running.

meanings.sent1: She was blinking fast on the track, leaving her competitors behind.
meanings.sent2: He was blinking tired after working a double shift.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit disappear in the blink of an eye, or should I say, in a blinking flash.
meanings.sent4: Time was blinking slow as he waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks lit up the sky blinking brightly on New Year's Eve.

meanings.definition: (verb) to close and open the eyes quickly and repeatedly
meanings.sent1: The baby was blinking in wonder at the colorful mobile above the crib.
meanings.sent2: She blinked in surprise when she saw her old friend at the grocery store.
meanings.sent3: The cat was blinking lazily in the sun, enjoying its afternoon nap.
meanings.sent4: The stars blinked in the night sky like distant diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse blinked its light across the dark sea, guiding ships to safety.
